encodingDesc.p: The file data/letters/1870-9/1872/72-01-23-final.doc was converted from Microsoft Word format into TEI using an XProc pipeline.

head.supplied: ¶ Case for Stuttgart ¶ . ¶ 1 ¶ ¶ parcel for Professor Petermann ¶ per ¶ Somersetshire ¶ 23 January 1872...

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: MS written by a clerk. The list may have accompanied M to F. von Krauss, 1 February 1872 (in this edition as 72-02-01b), in which M refers to sending this case, or it may be the list that Sonder in May 1872 told Krauss he was forwarding after receiving it from M (see W. Sonder to F. von Krauss, 20 May 1872 (in this edition as M72-05-20)). The latter is more likely since Sonder refers to the case's including a package that needed to be forwarded to August Petermann, as does this list. There is a pencilled note by M at the top of the list: '[…] braun gemalt' [… painted brown].

cell.p:
parcel for George Town
Tas? Though the clerk wrote 'f' (= für), it is most unlikely that M would have asked Krauss to forward this item; the entry must refer to a parcel from Georgetown, not one intended for it.

div.p:
23 January 1872
Somertsetshire left Melbourne on 27 January 1872; listed amongst its cargo were 'five cases specimens of natural history' (Argus, 29 January 1872, p. 4).
